tripleplay.ui

Class Button

  • java.lang.Object
    • tripleplay.ui.Element<T>
      • tripleplay.ui.Widget<T>
        • tripleplay.ui.TextWidget<T>
          • tripleplay.ui.ClickableTextWidget<Button>
            • tripleplay.ui.Button
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Clickable<Button>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LongPressButton

    public class Button
extends ClickableTextWidget<Button>
implements Clickable<Button>
    A button that displays text, or an icon, or both.

    • Field Summary

    • Field Detail

      • DEBOUNCE_DELAY

        public static Style<Integer> DEBOUNCE_DELAY
        A delay (in milliseconds) during which a button will remain unclickable after it has been clicked. This ensures that users don't hammer away at a button, triggering multiple responses (which code rarely protects against). Inherited.

      • text

        public final react.Value<String> text
        The text displayed by this widget, or null.

      • icon

        public final react.Value<Icon> icon
        The icon displayed by this widget, or null.

    • Method Detail

      • bindText

        public Button bindText(react.ValueView<String> text)
        Binds the text of this button to the supplied reactive value. The current text will be adjusted to match the state of text.

      • bindIcon

        public Button bindIcon(react.ValueView<Icon> icon)
        Binds the icon of this button to the supplied reactive value. The current icon will be adjusted to match the state of icon.

      • click

        public void click()
        Programmatically triggers a click of this button. This triggers the action sound, but does not cause any change in the button's visualization. Note: this does not check the button's enabled state, so the caller must handle that if appropriate.

      • onClick

        public Button onClick(react.Slot<? super Button> onClick)
        A convenience method for registering a click handler. Assumes you don't need the result of SignalView.connect(react.Slot<? super T>), because it throws it away.

      • clicked

        public react.SignalView<Button> clicked()
        Description copied from interface: Clickable
        A signal that is emitted when this element is clicked.
        Specified by:
        clicked in interface Clickable<Button>

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
